pullrequest.title: Use gzdev tool to install repositories

content.raw: Yep. The Gazebo developers tool project aka `gzdev` is and idea to make some useful tasks for Gazebo users/developers easier. It's based on plugins each of them doing one particular task. The `master` branch hosts the `spawn`plugin \(an idea superseded by rocon months after\). The new module named used here `repository` \(in[ this pull request](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pulls)\) is designed to install Gazebo/ROS repositories in a Linux system providing a single point for configuration so we can change the repositories URLs or keys in a single step.  [This change to the readme file](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/6/files?short_path=04c6e90#diff-04c6e90faac2675aa89e2176d2eec7d8) has a little man page for it.
